Thank you for your patience. ::: :::: This section details the practical aspects of preparing your environment to work with Unix/Linux systems. It is designed to guide you through various setup processes, catering to different preferences and requirements. Weâ€™ll cover working with shells and terminals, setting up a virtual machine, and using Quarto documents to execute Bash commands. ### Shells and Terminals @sec-sh-term covers the differences between shells and terminals, and some common options for both. ### Virtual Machines @sec-vms covers how to run Unix on a virtual machine. ### Quarto @sec-quarto covers how to setup up the [Quarto](https://iterm2.com/) publishing system. :::: {.callout-note collapse='false' appearance='simple' icon=false} ## [See a typo, error, or something missing?]{style='font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.15em;'} ::: {style='font-size: 1.00em; color: #282b2d;'} Please open an issue on [GitHub.](https://github.com/mjfrigaard/fm-unix/issues/new) ::: ::::
